Line 77: Line 77:
===Quality of compliance test suites===
===Quality of compliance test suites===
â
Additionally, the compliance test suites have been criticized for being buggy and incomplete—most notably, in 2005 [[Ulrich Drepper]] criticized the LSB for poorly written tests which can cause incompatibility between LSB-certified distributions when some implement incorrect behavior to make buggy tests work, while others apply for and receive waivers from complying with the tests.<ref name="drepper-2005">{{cite web | url = http://udrepper.livejournal.com/8511.html | title = Do you still think the LSB has some value? | author = Drepper, Ulrich | date = 2005-09-17 | accessdate = 2010-04-26}}</ref> He also denounced a lack of application testing, pointing out that testing only distributions can never solve the problem of applications relying on implementation-defined behavior.<ref name="drepper-2005"/> However, the LSB test coverage has been improved significantly in recent years.{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}} Also, the Linux Foundation released a tool to address application compatibility testing.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://ldn.linuxfoundation.org/lsb/all-about-linux-application-checker | title = All About the Linux Application Checker | publisher = [[Linux Foundation]] | year = 2008 | accessdate = 2010-04-26}}</ref>
+
Additionally, the compliance test suites have been criticized for being buggy and incomplete—most notably, in 2005 [[Ulrich Drepper]] criticized the LSB for poorly written tests which can cause incompatibility between LSB-certified distributions when some implement incorrect behavior to make buggy tests work, while others apply for and receive waivers from complying with the tests.<ref name="drepper-2005">{{cite web | url = http://udrepper.livejournal.com/8511.html | title = Do you still think the LSB has some value? | author = Drepper, Ulrich | date = 2005-09-17 | accessdate = 2010-04-26}}</ref> He also denounced a lack of application testing, pointing out that testing only distributions can never solve the problem of applications relying on implementation-defined behavior.<ref name="drepper-2005"/> However, the LSB test coverage has been improved significantly in recent years.{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}} Also, the [[Linux Foundation]] released a tool to address application compatibility testing.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://ldn.linuxfoundation.org/lsb/all-about-linux-application-checker | title = All About the Linux Application Checker | publisher = [[Linux Foundation]] | year = 2008 | accessdate = 2010-04-26}}</ref>
